Key Match Events: Kawhi Leonard shot 4 for 11 from the field, 3 for 5 from 3-point range and 1 for 3 from the free-throw line for 12 points.
Pre-Game Insights: Coach Tyronn Lue's team, which at 20-15 is very much in the mix in the crowded Western Conference, just acquired a six-time All-Star and two-time NBA Finals MVP.
Post-Match Reflections: Lue said Saturday night, “We can get better. We’ve got to start adding offensively now that Kawhi’s back. … We’re ready to build off this; we’ve done a good job of holding it down, but now we’ve got to continue to take those next steps to be a great team.”
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Clippers are fourth in the NBA in defensive rating (108.3), giving up the fourth-fewest points per game (107.9).
Others: Kawhi Leonard's return from a knee injury has raised hopes for the Clippers' playoff chances.
